metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36242 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the cryptography package before 3.3.2 for Python, certain sequences of update calls to symmetrically encrypt multi-GB values could result in an integer overflow and buffer overflow, as demonstrated by the Fernet class.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4
python3-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Versions in groovy and earlier don't support chunking in update_into. Attempting reproducer on groovy and focal errors out with: OverflowError: integer 4294967296 does not fit '32-bit int' which seems to indicate there is a size check being performed and they aren't vulnerable to this issue.

criterions.comment: python-cryptography package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4').
